meanings.definition: The location where a film is shot.
meanings.sent1: The filmsetting for the movie was a beautiful beach.
meanings.sent2: The director scouted the perfect filmsetting in the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The filmsetting in the middle of the desert made the crew feel like they were in a different world.
meanings.sent4: The filmsetting of the abandoned mansion added an eerie atmosphere to the horror film.
meanings.sent5: The filmsetting of the bustling city brought life to the movie scenes.

meanings.definition: The process of selecting and arranging elements for a film.
meanings.sent1: The filmsetting involved choosing the right props and costumes.
meanings.sent2: During pre-production, the filmsetting phase is crucial for setting the tone of the movie.
meanings.sent3: The filmsetting task became a fun challenge for the production team.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail in the filmsetting process elevated the overall look of the film.
meanings.sent5: The filmsetting work required creativity and precision to bring the director's vision to life.

meanings.definition: The act of adjusting the settings on a camera for filming.
meanings.sent1: Before shooting, the cinematographer focused on the filmsetting for optimal lighting.
meanings.sent2: The filmsetting on the camera needed to be adjusted to capture the scene accurately.
meanings.sent3: The filmsetting on the camera was accidentally changed, resulting in a blurry shot.
meanings.sent4: She quickly corrected the filmsetting on the camera to ensure clear footage.
meanings.sent5: The filmsetting adjustment improved the quality of the film's visuals.
